    • Method Detail

      • getFilePathFromUri

        public static java.lang.String getFilePathFromUri(Context context,
                                                  Uri uriPath)
        Get the file path from Uri. It works with new Storage Provider APIs, which is available from VERSION_CODES#KITKAT / API Level 19.
        Parameters:
        context - -Context.
        uriPath - -Uri Media content Uri.
        Returns:
        String name of the file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.
        See Also:
        ContentResolver#query(Uri, String[], String, String[], String)}.

      • isExternalStorageDocument

        public static boolean isExternalStorageDocument(Uri uri)
        Checks whether the provided Uri is from external storage.
        Parameters:
        uri - -Uri to check.
        Returns:
        boolean -returns true if the uri is from external storage, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • isDownloadsDocument

        public static boolean isDownloadsDocument(Uri uri)
        Checks whether the provided Uri is from download document provider.
        Parameters:
        uri - -Uri to check.
        Returns:
        boolean -returns true if the uri is download document, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • isMediaDocument

        public static boolean isMediaDocument(Uri uri)
        Checks whether the provided Uri is media document.
        Parameters:
        uri - -Uri to check.
        Returns:
        boolean -returns true if the uri is media document, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • getFileNameFromUri

        public static java.lang.String getFileNameFromUri(Context context,
                                                  Uri uri)
        Gets the String file name from the Uri.
        Parameters:
        uri - -Uri to check.
        Returns:
        Whether the Uri authority is ExternalStorageProvider.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.
